pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:0.5_0: The training rule on receiving respectfully
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were receiving almsfood contemptuously, as if wanting to throw it away. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.3.1_0: “‘I will receive almsfood respectfully,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.4_0: He should receive the almsfood respectfully;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives almsfood contemptuously, as if wanting to throw it away, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.7.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk27:1.9_0: The seventh rule, the training rule on married girls, is finished.
